finalProject

Class Filter

  • java.lang.Object
    • finalProject.Filter

  • public class Filter
extends java.lang.Object
    The class responsible for filtering sensor data.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mathieu

    • Constructor Detail

      • Filter

        public Filter(Filter.Type t,
              SampleProvider s,
              int window)
        Constructor for Filter.
        Parameters:
        t - The type of filter used.
        s - The sensor (and mode) that will be filtered.
        window - The amount of samples used to calculate the filtered data. If the type is DERIVATIVE, the window will be automatically set to 2. If the type is EMPTY, the window will be set to 1.

    • Method Detail

      • addSample

        public void addSample()
        Adds a new sensor reading to the samples.

      • saturateSamples

        public void saturateSamples(int period)
        Fills the entire sample array with new readings separated by a time interval.
        Parameters:
        period - The time interval between two readings.

      • getFilteredData

        public double getFilteredData()
        Calculates the filtered data depending on the type of the filter. For type AVERAGE, the result will be the average of all the samples. For type MEDIAN, the result will be the median of all the samples. For type DERIVATIVE, the result will be the difference between the current and previous sample.
        Returns:
        The filtered data.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the filter's current value which fits the EV3's LCD screen.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The filter's current value, in string form.
